disease: Merkel cell carcinoma of the right lower eyelid, including canthus

symptoms.name: Vision obstruction
symptoms.pattern: Possible, depending on lesion size and location

physical_findings: Painless solitary nodule with violaceous hue
Lymphadenopathy (in up to 37% of patients at diagnosis)
Enlarged preauricular and cervical lymph nodes

imaging_findings.PET/CT: May show enhancing lesion consistent with metastases
imaging_findings.Other imaging: May be required to evaluate for systemic spread if lymphadenopathy or diffuse eyelid involvement is present

required: Histopathological and immunohistochemical analysis showing characteristic features of Merkel cell carcinoma
supportive: Clinical presentation consistent with MCC (AEIOU mnemonic: Asymptomatic, Expanding rapidly, Immunosuppression, Older than 50, UV-exposed site)
Positive immunohistochemical staining for cytokeratin 8, 18, 19, pancytokeratin with cytokeratin 20, neuron specific enolase; negative for S-100 protein
Electron microscopy demonstrating dense-core cytoplasmic granules

differential_diagnoses: Cutaneous metastases from other cancers (especially metastatic small-cell lung cancer)
